definition: stamp with fury/fly into a rage
sudden/violent/cruel/to show or expose/to injure
surname Bao
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
as/as if/such as
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific

sentences.english: Mr Williams refused his friend's advice and flounced out of the office.
sentences.chinese: 絕接受他朋友的勸告，暴跳如雷地離開了辦公室。

sentences.english: She refused my advice and flounced out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 她拒絕接受我的勸告，暴跳如雷地離開了房子。

sentences.english: He got further steamed up about reporters who followed him everywhere, everywhen.
sentences.chinese: 他對那些隨時隨地跟着他的記者暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: The door flew open, and Father stormed into the room, in a very bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 門猛地開了，父親從外邊暴跳如雷地走進屋子裏來。

sentences.english: When the Soviet Union withdrew its nuclear missiles from Cuba, Che was furious.
sentences.chinese: 當蘇聯從古巴撤回導彈時，格瓦拉暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: They ramped and raged like a pack of trapped beasts.
sentences.chinese: 他們像一羣被圍困的野獸，張牙舞爪，暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: The article caused a storm of fans' indignation and outrage.
sentences.chinese: 這篇文章導致了球迷氣憤填膺，暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: Still outraged in the morning, he is committed to a psychiatric clinic.
sentences.chinese: 到了早上他依然是暴跳如雷，因而被送進精神病院。

sentences.english: He was on the rampage when he got to know, that his best friend had deceived him.
sentences.chinese: 當他得知他最好的朋欺騙了他時，暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: According to the gossip, Mr. Ede is absolutely furious.
sentences.chinese: 據愛說長道短的人說愛德先生肯定是暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: Who flies into a rage every time I want to go back to work.
sentences.chinese: 每次我想出去工作他就暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: Furious, Zhong Kui killed himself and became the spirit of catching ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗暴跳如雷，當場自殺，死後就成了捉鬼的神靈。

definition: to get really angry
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to abuse roundly
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
angry/indignant
to get angry/to fume
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
